text:
Our country mourns the loss of Charlie Kirk.

Charlie was a Christian, a father, a son, and a leader with whom many of us enjoyed working.

Charlie led a movement that was organized through the simple principle of respectful political discourse.

The structure of each of his events was built around direct, civil dialogue across college campuses with America’s future leaders.

Until yesterday.

There is a growing ideology infecting our country that teaches its depraved adherents that people of different perspectives are not worthy of life.

We must defeat this evil, and serve swift justice to those who perpetrate it.

May Charlie Kirk forever Rest in Peace, and may his voice and approach to free speech be remembered for generations to come.

Today, we remember and honor the innocent lives lost from the terrorist attack on September 11, 2001.

May we Never Forget.
We lift up Charlie Kirk in prayer.  May he fully and swiftly recover.

This weekend, I visited Muscogee, Carroll, and Troup Counties!

✅  Addressed hundreds of hunters from our district at NG Turf’s annual Dinner and Doves event
✅  Celebrated the newest college football rivalry in Georgia: The Clash of Highway 29, between LaGrange College and Point University
✅  Delivered color commentary on the Columbus Clingstones broadcast during their last homestand of the season

History in the Making: This Saturday marks the start of the newest college football rivalry in Georgia: the Clash of Highway 29 between the LaGrange College Panthers (@LaGrangeFTBL) and the Point University Skyhawks (@PointFootball)! https://t.co/C7EjASpzmL

It was an incredible honor to welcome Vice President @JDVance, Administrator Lee Zeldin (@EPALeeZeldin), and Administrator Kelly Loeffler (@SBA_Kelly) to my hometown of Peachtree City.

We celebrated President Trump’s Working Families Tax Cuts and historic deregulation efforts that have unleashed economic prosperity across Georgia’s 3rd Congressional District and our entire country!

Over the past two days, I had a wonderful time in Troup, Harris, and Muscogee Counties!

✅  Toured DNA Technical Fabrics, one of the last denim plants left in America
✅  Discussed Surface Transportation Reauthorization efforts at a C.W. Matthews asphalt plant
✅  Met with the leadership of Aflac, one of the largest employers in our district
✅  Visited LaGrange College and Point University to discuss ways we can partner to create wonderful opportunities for students in our district

I had a great time in Fayette, Meriwether, and Upson Counties yesterday!

✅  Hosted a Roundtable Discussion with the Fayette County Development Authority and Chamber of Commerce
✅  Met with a company poised to make a significant investment in Coweta County
✅  Toured the largest construction project in Fayette County
✅  Visited Trilith Studios to learn ways we can reshore film production to America
✅  Addressed constituents in Meriwether County
✅  Met with Upson County Law Enforcement and addressed constituents in Thomaston

I am incredibly proud to introduce the bipartisan Muhammad Ali American Boxing Revival Act, which provides boxers with more opportunities, better pay, and greater safety standards.

Professional boxing is the only sport regulated by Congress, and ambiguity in current law — adopted over a quarter-century ago — has stifled investment.

Congressional action is needed to revive this once-great American sport, and this bipartisan legislation establishes a framework for innovation to flourish.

🥊 #AliBoxingRevivalAct #MAABRA

Today, the House Small Business Committee unanimously advanced the SBA IT Modernization Reporting Act (H.R. 4491), bipartisan legislation I introduced with @RepGilCisneros to modernize the SBA’s tech systems so America’s small businesses can continue to grow, hire, and thrive!

The first six months of President Trump’s second term have yielded incredible results for our Country.

Gas prices are down, the stock market is up, and our borders are more secure than ever before! https://t.co/54bqfMJlXt

Happy Independence Day to all!

May you have a wonderful day with family and friends as we celebrate the birth of our country! https://t.co/bDDZ7Pt80t

Today, we PASSED President Trump’s signature legislation: H.R. 1, the One Big Beautiful Bill Act.

This law delivers the largest tax cut in history for hardworking Americans and codifies President Trump’s and House Republicans’ campaign promises:

✅  Makes the 2017 Trump Tax Cuts Permanent
✅  No Tax on Tips
✅  No Tax on Overtime
✅  Tax Relief for Seniors
✅  Eliminates Waste, Fraud, and Abuse from Bloated Federal Programs
✅  Fully Implements President Trump’s Border Security Plan
✅  Funds the Golden Dome Missile Defense System to Protect our Homeland
✅  Ends the Radical Left's War on American Energy Production

Last November, over 77 million Americans voted for President Trump and Republican governance in Washington, D.C., and within the first six months of President Trump’s second term, we passed our agenda.

The Golden Age for Georgia’s 3rd Congressional District and the United States of America is here!
I stand with our brave military stationed across the world and President Trump, our Commander in Chief. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/djdH1SZgGr

I had a wonderful time in Meriwether County yesterday!

✅ Breakfast with County Commissioner Threadgill in Manchester
✅ Briefing from the Chamber of Commerce in Warm Springs
✅ Spoke to the Rotary Club at lunch
✅ Toured the inspiring Roosevelt Warm Springs Campus operated by the Georgia Vocational Rehabilitation Agency
✅ Visited Sheriff Smith at the historic courthouse in Greenville

Incredible things are happening in Meriwether County!

I enjoyed touring The Coca-Cola Company’s innovation facility, and meeting with representatives of The White House Task Force on the FIFA World Cup 2026 today.

The Coca-Cola Company employs hundreds of people across our Congressional District, and U.S. Soccer will soon call Fayette County home, just in time for us to welcome the World Cup to Atlanta!

Happy Father’s Day to the incredible men who protect, raise, and encourage their children.

May we celebrate and remember our fathers today!

Happy 250th Birthday to the United States Army!

As we celebrate our Army’s semiquincentennial anniversary, we remember its founding, after our forefathers won a decisive victory at Lexington and Concord, and we remember the millions of Americans who have since served and are proudly serving in this historic branch of our Armed Forces.

May our Army and our brave servicemen and servicewomen protect our Country for another 250 years, and beyond!
Tonight, let us pray for our brave soldiers across the Middle East and the Jewish State of Israel, our strongest ally in the region.
https://t.co/Poj5xYcy8m

It was my honor!

I hope everyone has an opportunity to visit historic Synovus Park, and see Fuzzy and our Clingstones in action.

It was an honor to convene today’s Small Business Innovation Subcommittee (@HouseSmallBiz) hearing on the economic impact of minor league baseball, and to welcome Georgia’s own Columbus Clingstones (@GoClingstones) to Congress!

Watch below to learn how the Clingstones are impacting communities across the southern part of our district!

This morning, at Veteran's Memorial Park in Newnan, we honored our courageous veterans who made the ultimate sacrifice.

During the ceremony, an inspirational story about Private First Class Eldrid Hill Reynolds was told by his extended family.

PFC Reynolds lost his life in France, serving our country during World War II, and lays in rest at Oak Hill Cemetery in Newnan.

May we honor and cherish all who gave their lives, to protect the freedom we enjoy today.

Today, we honor the courageous men and women who made the ultimate sacrifice for our country. 
 
May we always remember that freedom is never free. https://t.co/MdVcsENw4k

The incredible people of Georgia’s 3rd Congressional District overwhelmingly supported President Trump’s America First agenda last November, and today, House Republicans passed his cornerstone campaign promise: the One Big Beautiful Bill Act.

Today’s vote will unleash our economy and usher in a new Golden Age for Georgia’s 3rd Congressional District and the United States of America!

21 straight hours and 30 minutes later, and after hundreds of obstructionist Democrat tactics, our House Rules Committee, by a vote of 8-4, APPROVED immediate consideration of President Trump’s signature legislation: the One, Big, Beautiful Bill — the largest Tax Cut in American history.

History is on the horizon!

We just gaveled in a historic Rules Committee hearing to advance President Trump’s signature legislation: the One, Big, Beautiful Bill — the largest Tax Cut in American history.

We are starting EARLY this morning because Democrats are expected to introduce an avalanche of amendments to delay much-needed tax relief for middle-class families and senior citizens.

I am honored to serve on the Rules Committee, and give my Congressional District an important voice in this debate.

The incredible people of Georgia’s 3rd Congressional District overwhelmingly supported President Trump’s America First agenda last November, and we are enacting it today!

Happy Mother’s Day to the incredible women who nurture, raise, and care for us!

A mother’s love is like no other, and today, we celebrate you! https://t.co/YpePkqv5Ij

Thank you, President Trump, for signing into law our legislation that REPEALS a job-killing Biden regulation that endangered a manufacturing plant in our Congressional District!

Together, we are saving jobs and putting American manufacturing first!

Today, I was honored to welcome U.S. Secretary of Energy Chris Wright to Spalding County to celebrate the REPEAL of a job-killing Biden regulation that endangered a manufacturing plant in our Congressional District.

Rinnai America Corporation hosted us at its state-of-the-art facility where tankless water heaters are built.  Joe Biden’s Department of Energy wanted to BAN these water heaters, but, working across the aisle, I led the bipartisan fight to REPEAL this regulation and save hundreds of jobs in our District.

Secretary Wright is the first Cabinet Member to visit Spalding County, and I’m excited to continue making history with him!

On Tuesday, I had a wonderful time visiting Pike County to meet with Sheriff Jimmy Thomas and to host a lunch for mayors from Pike, Lamar, Upson, and Spalding Counties.  I was honored to bring President Trump to Zebulon in October — the first visit by a President to Pike County since FDR’s fishing trips in the 1930s — and I look forward to continued attention from the Trump Administration.

On Wednesday, I visited Heard County Sheriff Ross Henry in Franklin and Haralson County Sheriff Stacy Williams in Bremen to brief them on ways in which I can be helpful to our brave law enforcement.  Later, Sheriff Williams and I visited Buchanan Primary School to learn from school teachers what’s needed to improve students’ lives and educational experience.
He is Risen!  Wishing everyone a happy and blessed Easter Sunday!

Thank you to the incredibly talented air traffic controllers of A80 Atlanta TRACON for inviting me to tour your approach control facility in Peachtree City, today!

I thoroughly enjoyed our discussion with representatives from 3 aviation labor unions — NATCA, ALPA, and SWAPA — and Delta Air Lines.

Later, I visited ALTA Refrigeration, a market leader for industrial refrigeration systems, to discuss much-needed regulatory relief!

We had a wonderful time in Carroll and Haralson Counties today!

I met with the President and administrators of the University of West Georgia, visited cattlemen at the Carroll County Livestock Sales Barn, hosted a small business discussion at Solve IT Mediation, toured Downtown Carrollton with Mayor Cason, addressed members of the Carrollton City Council, and delivered remarks at the Haralson County Historical Society.

Thank you for an incredible day!
The first 100 Days of the 119th Congress have delivered meaningful results for the incredible people of Georgia’s 3rd Congressional District — and we’re just getting started! https://t.co/N8CbbXEhLb
Thank you, Mr. President! https://t.co/v5Wzamw89b

Tonight, we mourn the loss of two fellow Georgians — a father and son — from Harris County who lost their lives in today’s storm.

Let’s keep their family in our thoughts and prayers.

Thank you, @LtGovJonesGA, for inviting me to address the Georgia Senate today.

The Senate has long been the cradle of leadership in Georgia, and our partnership with the Senators whose constituencies I share — John F. Kennedy, Tim Bearden, Marty Harbin, Matt Brass, and Randy Robertson — has already delivered meaningful results for Georgia’s 3rd Congressional District!

I am honored to introduce bipartisan legislation commemorating Delta Air Lines' 100-year anniversary. Delta is the world's premier international airline, and its success has transformed the communities I proudly represent in Congress.  

The history of my hometown, Peachtree City, is interwoven with the growth of Delta, and I am excited to work with my colleagues - Republicans and Democrats - to honor Delta's 100-year history of connecting people to the world and to each other. 

https://t.co/COFv5aP3CK

The @HaralsonSheriff’s Office has done a fantastic job keeping residents informed of damage caused by last night’s storm.

My office is in communication with power providers to address any outstanding issues.

Thank you to our brave first responders!

Tonight, severe weather across West Georgia and Metro Atlanta is expected.  Below (⬇️) are the estimated times of impact from the Georgia Emergency Management and Homeland Security Agency.

To best prepare, please keep these tips in mind:

☎️  Unmute your phone and ensure ‘Do Not Disturb’ is off
🔋  Charge your phone throughout the day
📻  If you have a weather radio, test it, to ensure it’s working properly
⛑️  Have a safety kit in place before nightfall

Today, I voted YES on H.R. 1968. President Trump, House Republican Leadership, the House Freedom Caucus, and one Democrat supported this legislation to keep the government open.                   

This bipartisan legislation extends government funding through September 30, 2025, as we continue to partner with President Trump’s efforts to reduce wasteful government spending and lower our country’s debt.

I urge my colleagues in the Senate to support this bipartisan bill in support of our seniors, veterans, and brave men and women in uniform!

Congratulations to Andrew Hughes on being nominated by President Trump to serve as our Country’s 13th Deputy Secretary of Housing and Urban Development!

Andrew and I worked together on President Trump’s first campaign in 2016, and he was an incredibly effective chief of staff for @SecretaryCarson throughout President Trump’s first Administration.

Andrew is one of the most thoughtful and determined folks I know, and he will do a fantastic job working under President Trump’s and Secretary Turner’s leadership!

Congratulations to Russell Henley of Columbus, Georgia on his @PGATour @APInv WIN today!

Georgia’s 3rd Congressional District is very proud of you!
President Trump delivered an incredible speech this evening.  House Republicans look forward to working with him to Make our Country Great Again!

The Number 1 movie in America right now is @CaptainAmerica, and it was filmed right here in downtown Grantville, Georgia — in the heart of our Congressional District.

If you saw the movie, you’ll recognize this street. Come check it out and visit @MayorProctor, who is doing incredible things for the people of Grantville!
@Rinnai I applaud my 11 Democrat colleagues for joining House Republicans today to pass this legislation to preserve and champion blue collar jobs in the heart of Georgia! ⬇️ https://t.co/XMBnY4LA9g
@Rinnai Over 500 of my constituents depend on the success of these water heaters ⬇️ https://t.co/LPDlQnfknt
A MAJORITY of the water heaters this regulation tried to ban are manufactured at @Rinnai state-of-the-art facility in Griffin, Georgia ⬇️ https://t.co/ULlWrJAnTV
This job-killing regulation would eliminate consumer choice by enabling government bureaucrats to pick winners and losers in the marketplace ⬇️ https://t.co/U087uhb5JB
On December 26, 2024 – the day after Christmas – the Biden Administration imposed a regulation that would ban the type of water heaters manufactured in Griffin, Georgia ⬇️ https://t.co/8qEG6kGHYZ

🧵Today, the House of Representatives, with a BIPARTISAN majority, passed the resolution @USRepGaryPalmer and I introduced to REPEAL a Biden regulation that would have eliminated hundreds of jobs in our Congressional District. 

Here’s how it happened ⬇️

Joe Biden imposed a regulation the day after Christmas that put hundreds of manufacturing jobs in jeopardy in our Congressional District.

I am proud to lead the fight to pass legislation this week that will CANCEL this regulation, saving hundreds of jobs in Georgia!

Congratulations to Christopher Bell (@CBellRacing) for winning the Ambetter Health 400 at @ATLMotorSpdwy in Georgia’s 3rd Congressional District!

A great, entertaining weekend of @NASCAR Racing!
I had a wonderful time with the incredible people of Coweta, Carroll, and Fayette Counties over the past few days! https://t.co/W6s488ZJ1F

I am proud to lead the fight in the House of Representatives to disapprove and nullify the Biden Administration’s job-killing regulation imposed on the specific water heaters manufactured in my district.

I am determined to protect and champion these American manufacturing jobs.

Today, our @DOGECommittee convened our first hearing to investigate trillions of taxpayer dollars wasted through fraud and abuse.

Instead of joining us in a productive manner, my Democrat colleagues spent their time ranting about @ElonMusk at a 9-to-1 ratio!

See below ⬇️ https://t.co/bo915ETlIo
Through President Trump’s leadership, we will finally achieve peace in the Middle East!

Congratulations to Billy Kirkland on being nominated by President Trump to serve as Assistant Secretary of the Interior for Indian Affairs!

Billy is extremely talented, respected by all, and committed to improving the lives of our Native American citizens.

He’s also one of my best friends and will do an incredible job working under President Trump’s and Secretary Burgum’s leadership!

169 years ago today, the Georgia General Assembly established Haralson County, named after a Congressman and Major General in the Georgia militia, Hugh A. Haralson, who previously represented our Congressional District.

Haralson County's cities and towns continue to inspire.  For over a century, Bremen has been a hub of commerce.  Tallapoosa was once a gold-mining town, and it today retains its unique Southern charm.  Waco is home to a 90-acre campus of West Georgia Technical College.  And, a historic, picturesque courthouse sits at the heart of Buchanan, the county seat.

My family were among Haralson County's first settlers, and I am honored to represent the incredible people of Haralson County in Congress!

I am honored to serve on @RepMTG’s D.O.G.E. Subcommittee.

I worked in President Trump’s White House for four years, and I will use that experience to help @RepMTG eliminate waste, fraud, abuse, and mismanagement within federal agencies, so that our federal government may better serve the American taxpayer and the incredible people of Georgia’s 3rd Congressional District.

A new Golden Age for America has begun!

Nine years ago, I joined President Trump’s first campaign for President.

Since then, I’ve proudly worked by his side — before, during, and after his historic first term.

Today, as he is sworn in as our 47th President, a new Golden Age for America begins! https://t.co/ecYpoZbII7

Thank you, Chairman @RepRWilliams, for appointing me Chairman of the Subcommittee on Innovation, Entrepreneurship, and Workforce Development.  

I am excited to work under your leadership to be an advocate for America’s Small Business Owners!

This morning, I delivered my first speech on the Floor of the U.S. House of Representatives, honoring a few notable moments of President Jimmy Carter’s legacy within Georgia’s 3rd Congressional District.

Thank you to the Fayette County Historical Society, The Newnan Times-Herald, the Meriwether Historical Society, and the Heard County Historical Center & Museum for helping compile this research to honor the life and legacy of a remarkable Georgian, the 39th President of the United States of America, Jimmy Carter.

9 years ago, I joined President Trump’s first campaign for President.  Since then, our America First movement has grown stronger, delivering a clear mandate for change.  

Today, we certified the historic election of President Trump and Vice President Vance – another step forward as we Make America Great Again!
